text: " jean , if monsieur pleases , " replied the newcomer , " jean passepartout , a surname which has clung to me because i have a natural aptness for going out of one business into another . i believe i 'm honest , monsieur , but , to be outspoken , i 've had several trades . i 've been an itinerant singer , a circus - rider , when i used to vault like leotard , and dance on a rope like blondin . then i got to be a professor of gymnastics , so as to make better use of my talents ; and then i was a sergeant fireman at paris , and assisted at many a big fire . but i quitted france five years ago , and , wishing to taste the sweets of domestic life , took service as a valet here in england . finding myself out of place , and hearing that monsieur phileas fogg was the most exact and settled gentleman in the united kingdom , i have come to monsieur in the hope of living with him a tranquil life , and forgetting even the name of passepartout . "
